intro: Silene vivianii subsp. getula, commonly known as the Getulian campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as cliffs and slopes. It produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous tiny seeds. Silene vivianii subsp. getula is known for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
